item.title: Destiny 2: The Final Shape - Gameplay Trailer
item.description: Check out the gameplay trailer for Destiny 2's The Final Shape expansion, the epic story conclusion to Bungie's first-person shooter.

item.title: Roblox: Anime Defenders Tier List
item.description:
Anime Defenders offers players a tower defense Roblox experience. But instead of towers, you have to use units from popular anime. And if you have always wondered which character is the strongest, then this Anime Defenders Tier List is what you need.

Each unit has unique skills that can be effective against certain opponents. But this does not mean they are all equal in strength since some destroy waves of enemies much more effectively than others.

Anime Defenders Tier List

In Anime Defenders , what separates you from victory is a suitable strategy and the units you have chosen to clear the stage. However, RNG makes it quite difficult to select appropriate units. Therefore, you must farm Gems in Anime Defenders and roll new characters. And to make it easier for you, we ranked them all from strongest to weakest in our Anime Defenders Tier List.

Characters

Tiers

Elf Wizardess

S Tier

Chance Taker

S Tier

Pink Rockstar

S Tier

Carp

S Tier

Flame Dragon King

S Tier

The Gamer

S Tier

S Tier

S Tier

S Tier

A Tier

A Tier

A Tier

A Tier

A Tier

A Tier

A Tier

Pink Shinobi

A Tier

Sharpshooter

B Tier

Esper

B Tier

Vengeful Shinobi

B Tier

Strongest Swordsman

B Tier

Shinobi Form 3

B Tier

Spirit Hybrid

B Tier

Prince of Curses

C Tier

Cursed Sorcerer

C Tier

Black Leg Master

C Tier

Strongest Swordsman

C Tier

Ascended Saiyan

C Tier

Best Anime Defenders Characters

As you can see, most of the Anime Defenders characters are in the S and A tiers. It means you can assemble a powerful team without rolling characters a hundred times. However, it is worth noting that some units are so strong that they stand out even among others in their tier. Once you get them, you can forget about losing, as they will quickly destroy all enemies in their path.

  • Chance Taker - This is one of the best DPS in the game. Its strong point is its high damage after the first upgrades.
  • Pink Rockstar - This is a must-have unit for any battle, as it can boost the damage of other units.
  • Elf Wizardess - Last but not least, this is the best AoE damage dealer in Anime Defenders . You won't find anyone with that much area damage.

item.title: Wuthering Waves: Yuanwu Team Composition Guide
item.description:
Yuanwu is one of the most misunderstood characters in Wuthering Waves because of the roundabout way his kit works, which makes building a team around him a bit frustrating. To start, Yuanwu serves best as a dedicated sub-DPS/quick swap character who deals damage in quick bursts of 5 to 10 seconds before returning off-field. He enters a buffed state when his Forte Circuit is full and holds down his Resonance skill to break his signature pillar when it's on-field.

In this Lightning Infused state, his attacks gain more range, he learns a new combo with both his basic attacks and special attacks, and most importantly, his damage starts scaling off DEF% instead of ATK. This is crucial because, outside of the Lightning Infused state, Yuanwu is just a run-of-the-mill ATK% scaling character. This is both Yuanwu's strength and weakness at the same time. Strength because it makes him a much easier character to build, and weakness because, since he is almost always going to be built with DEF% stats on his echoes, he will only deal real damage while in his Lightning Infused state.

Another big upside to Yuanwu is that his skills and attacks deal direct Toughness/Vibration damage, draining the target's poise bar. This makes him a boss killer, especially useful in the Tower of Adversity. Here are some of the best team compositions that take advantage of his kit.

1 Yuanwu + Lingyang + Baizhi

The main reason for pairing Yuanwu with Lingyang, in particular, is because of the way his Liberation works. When used, Yuanwu's Liberation gives interruption immunity to all of his team members for ten seconds. For Lingyang, this is a huge deal because of how his Forte Circuit (Striding Lion) works. Lingyang's entire kit in Wuthering Waves revolves around him being on-field in the Striding Lion State, which lasts for exactly 10 seconds if used after his Liberation. While in this state, Lingyang's damage is increased massively, but he becomes unable to dodge and, if knocked out of the air, loses the Striding Lion state. With Yuanwu's Liberation providing interruption immunity, Lingyang doesn't need to worry about the one weakness of his signature ability.

The ideal rotation for this team is for Yuanwu to put down his pillar, destroy it with a heavy attack to enter his buffed state, and then use his Liberation once it ends. Lingyang swoops in as soon as this happens, with his Forte Circuit charged up, and holds Heavy Attack to become a lion dancer. Baizhi is mainly here to provide healing, and with the Moonlit Clouds set, ER is taken care of. Yuanwu should also be running the Moonlit Clouds set to ensure neither he nor Lingyang has to stay on-field for a long time to charge up their Liberations. This is a quickswap team, with most of the field time split between Lingyang and Yuanwu, with Baizhi only making an occasional appearance.

Yuanwu Team Roles

  • Yuanwu : Sub-DPS
  • Lingyang : DPS
  • Baizhi : Healer

2 Yuanwu + Jiyan + Verina

In this team, Jiyan is the main DPS, and he is meant to stay on-field for the duration of his Liberation (Teal Dragon state). Once his buffed state ends, Yuanwu can swoop in as a sub-DPS and do his complete rotation while Jiyan recovers energy in the background. As the best support in Wuthering Waves , Verina is a welcome addition, providing both Yuanwu and Jiyan the freedom to deal with as much damage as possible without worrying about their health.

While Yuanwu's direct damage as a sub-DPS is quite decent if built correctly, the main reason he shines in this team is because of his ability to deplete enemy Vibration (poise meter) in massive chunks when in his buffed state. Once this meter drops to zero, the enemies fall into a vulnerable state. This is where Jiyan can come in and clean up. This is especially effective against boss enemies with massive health bars who like to fly off like the Mourning Aix. Yuanwu can ground these types of bosses very effectively, making him an asset worth building.

Yuanwu Team Roles

  • Yuanwu : Sub-DPS
  • Jiyan : DPS
  • Verina : Healer, Buffer

item.title: Wuthering Waves: Sanhua Team Composition Guide
item.description:
Sanhua is one of the free 4-Star characters players will obtain by logging into Wuthering Waves five days in a row. A Glacio sword-wielder, Sanhua can function both as a main DPS and as a sub-DPS in a quick swap team. As a dedicated DPS character, her kit relies heavily on picture-perfect timing to execute her Forte Circuit skill correctly. With decent Energy Recharge (ER) and some Crit DMG/Crit Rate Echoes, she can function as an excellent AoE clearer.

As a support, her best trait is her Outro skill. With it, she gives any incoming unit a +38% Basic Attack Damage Deepen buff that lasts for a long time. This means that characters who rely on basic attack damage instead of skill damage or Liberation damage are her best pairings. Sanhua is an excellent choice for a sub-DPS for players building a second team to either clear the Tower of Adversity or to change things up. Here are some of the best characters to put on a team with her.

1 Sanhua + Encore + Verina

Encore's entire kit in Wuthering Waves revolves around dealing basic attack damage in her buffed state. She only uses her Heavy Attack when about to swap out. Sanhua's ability to increase the basic attack damage of any incoming unit by 38% is a massive increase in effective DPS for Encore, making her an ideal companion. Equipped with the Moonlit Clouds 5pcs set, Sanhua can not only provide the team with extra ER but also buffs Encore's damage by a further 22%. Sanhua can also pick up the slack for Encore when she is out of juice and needs to recharge her energy.

Verina's primary function is as a healer for when either Sanhua or Encore take damage, but she buffs Encore's (and Sanhua's) damage with her Liberation as well, applying the Photosynthesis mark to nearby enemies, which allows her to attack in tandem with the on-field unit even when she's not there.

Sanhua Team Roles

  • Encore : DPS
  • Sanhua : Sub-DPS, Buffer
  • Verina : Buffer, Healer

2 Sanhua + Lingyang + Baizhi

Like Encore, Lingyang also heavily relies on using his basic attacks to deal damage, making him a perfect unit to be paired with Sanhua. Both in his buffed Striding Lion State and in his normal state, Lingyang's damage comes from his lightning-fast basic punches. And since his attack speed is so fast, he takes full advantage of the +38% basic attack DMG buff Sanhua provides.

Additionally, as a single-target-focused DPS, Lingyang has few ways to deal with hordes of enemies. Sanhua covers that weakness by using her AoE damage skill and Forte Circuit to deal with multiple mobs. Baizhi is here as a healer and buffer, but if players are confident in their dodging and parrying skills, they can replace Baizhi with Yangyang to provide even more crowd control, allowing Sanhua's AoE attacks to hit enemies sucked into Yangyang's Liberation effect.

Sanhua Team Roles

  • Lingyang : DPS
  • Sanhua : Sub-DPS, Buffer
  • Baizhi : Buffer, Healer

3 Sanhua + Mortefi + Jianxin

Sanhua can also be built as a main DPS in Wuthering Waves by pairing her with Mortefi and Jianxin. Mortefi's Outro skill buffs Heavy Attack damage by +38%, which both Jianxin and Sanhua use quite often. Meanwhile, Sanhua's Outro skill buffs basic attacks by +38%, which Mortefi likes to use. The best rotation for this team would be for Sanhua to use her skill to summon the ice prism, break it with her Forte Circuit to build up her Concerto, and then switch to Mortefi. Mortefi would press all his buttons and echo abilities before switching to Jianxin, who would switch back to Mortefi, who would switch back to Sanhua, triggering the +38% heavy attack damage buff with his Outro skill.

This is a very quick swap-heavy team, with all characters taking nearly an equal amount of time on the field, quickly switching back and forth. The main thing to pay attention to, in addition to each character's kit, is to always fill up the Concerto meter before switching Mortefi into Sanhua or Jianxin and Sanhua into Mortefi in order to maximize damage.

Jianxin's Outro skill doesn't really matter all that much, and players can even replace her with another unit if they choose. However, Jianxin is an excellent backup option for boss fights as her skill allows her to perfectly parry any attack without any skill required. Her shields also give Sanhua and Mortefi the necessary bandwidth to not have to worry about taking attacks during their combos.

Sanhua Team Roles

  • Sanhua : DPS, Buffer
  • Mortefi : Sub-DPS, Buffer
  • Jianxin : Sub-DPS, Buffer, Shielder, Healer

item.title: Wuthering Waves: Yangyang Team Composition Guide
item.description:
Yangyang is a free 4-Star Aero character in Wuthering Waves who is unlocked right from the start of the main story. Players would be forgiven for thinking that, being a free 4-Star, she falls into the same category as Chixia, a sub-par character only meant to be played to get through the early parts of the story. No, instead, Yangyang is one of the most useful units in the game, specializing in crowd control and providing energy to her teammates.

Yangyang's Outro Skill, Whispering Breeze, gives 4 Energy per second for 5 seconds to whichever character she switches to. That's an easy 20 Energy to give to any unit players want. Both her Resonance skill and Liberation create a small black hole that sucks in nearby units and damages them at the same time (think Venti from Genshin Impact ). Not only is Yangyang's crowd control useful in the overworld for clearing hordes of smaller enemies, but it is also incredible in the Tower of Adversity, where getting enemies to clump together can make advancing much easier.

1 Yangyang + Jiyan + Verina

Jiyan is the main DPS in this team, spending the bulk of his time on-field dealing damage both in his Teal Dragon state and as his normal self. Yangyang's role here is to make Jiyan's life easier for him by using her CC to group together enemies. Jiyan's Liberation already gives him a decent AoE when dealing damage, but when paired with Yangyang, every swing of his sword hits an entire group of enemies. What's great about this pairing is that Jiyan's attacks don't knock back the enemies at all, and he stays in one place when using his attacks. Unlike Calcharo, who zips around the battlefield and repositions himself with every sword swing, Jiyan stays put. This makes combos where Yangyang pulls in enemies, and Jiyan deals damage easier to pull off.

Verina's role as a healer cannot be overlooked, as during Yangyang's crowd control, Jiyan doesn't want to move away from the enemies, which means either dodging everything perfectly or taking it on the chin. Verina's healing makes sure there are no repercussions to this playstyle, while her buffs ensure that Jiyan's attacks deal even more damage.

Yangyang Team Roles

  • Yangyang : Sub-DPS, Crowd Control
  • Jiyan : DPS
  • Verina : Healer, Buffer

2 Yangyang + Havoc Rover + Baizhi

All characters in this team are completely free for all players, and it is still one of the best team compositions you can ask for. Havoc Rover takes on the role of the main DPS, entering their Dark Surge state whenever possible to spam the skill, the basic attack + heavy attack combo, and the Liberation. Havoc Rover's Liberation is actually one of the highest damage-dealing abilities in the entire game, which can wipe out entire groups of enemies in one shot.

Yangyang's main role here is to give Havoc Rover as much energy as possible. While her Outro skill already takes care of this to an extent, equipping them with the Moonlit Clouds set also goes a long way. Havoc Rover also takes advantage of Yangyang's CC, but their basic attack combo has the tendency to scatter the gathered enemies. Baizhi is the background healer and buffer to both Rover and Yangyang, providing much-needed HP recovery to compensate for the aggressive playstyle.

Spectro Rover can also work in this team. However, as Spectro, they fit more of a Sub-DPS role than a proper on-field DPS. Spectro Rover wants to press their buttons and leave the field to other units, which can work in this team, but only if Yangyang takes on a more central role, which requires more investment in her abilities.

Yangyang Team Roles

  • Yangyang : Sub-DPS, Crowd Control
  • Havoc Rover : DPS
  • Baizhi : Healer, Buffer

3 Yangyang + Jianxin + Danjin

Jianxin and Yangyang both have very similar roles in the meta. They're crowd control units with different specialties. Jianxin takes on a jack-of-all-trades role, sucking in enemies for crowd control, tanking attacks with team-wide shields, and healing for a small amount when needed, all the while providing decent DPS.

Yangyang, on the other hand, specializes in providing ER to her teammates, ensuring their Liberations recharge as quickly as possible. For Danjin, this is the best of both worlds. As a dedicated DPS, Danjin's damage mainly comes from her Resonance skill, which hits enemies in an arc in front of her. While this damage is technically AoE, CC can help Danjin massively by grouping enemies in front of her, allowing her to hit them all with her skills. Not only that, but players will also have an easier time dodging attacks if they see everything coming. For Danjin, this is huge because she is an incredibly risky character to play, almost always teetering on the edge of dying because of the way her kit works.

Yangyang Team Roles

  • Yangyang : Sub-DPS, Crowd Control
  • Jianxin : Sub-DPS, Healer, Buffer, Shielder, Crowd Control
  • Danjin : DPS
